item.description:
We plan to continue with our banner waves on Route 1 at the Main street/Saugus overpass. We;; be there starting at 7:00 a.m. on Wed, November 14th. There is another overpass less than one mile south called Essex Street / Saugus overpass on Route 1.

IT WOULD BE EXCELLENT (AGAIN!) TO HAVE 2 OTHERS HOLD A BANNER AT THAT OVERPASS ON ROUTE 1 THE SAME MORNING-Wed, November 11th.

The repetition of seeing the sign twice, about a mile apart, is very strong memorability factor. It reinforces the name Ron Paul for President. Are there any takers to do this team work banner wave?. We'll have a banner at Main street overpass. Let's have two more holding a banner or very large sign at the Essex Street overpass.



Another factor is that there is likely a large number of commuters travelling south from NH, and also there is nearly always a backup on Route 1 between the hours of 7 and 9 a.m., which gives them plenty of time to ponder the Ron Paul for President 2008 sign!
item.name: Route 1 Sign Wave for Ron Paul
